intro: Elleanthus deuterohirtzii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss in dry conditions. The flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in dense clusters, making it a distinctive species within its genus.
